page.title: 06PLACE NAMES 4
page.content: { Grotto Wood :}The word 'grotto' means an imitation cave. Thus it is possible that in the woods are caves, possibly man-made ones, or perhaps they were used as kilns. It could be that the name is romantic and merely pertains to a fairy grotto or delightful place. {Lance Beck :}'Lance comes from the Old English 'hlinc'. This means the ledges of rising ground ie 'linces'. Thus 'Lance Beck' comes from the stream bordering the linces. {Mense House :}There are two possible meanings to this 'mense' means graceful or decorative. Thus the name could mean a fine and grand house or it could come 'manse'. A manse house is a house occupied by a church minister. This word occurs mainly in Scotland and does in most cases refer to the Scotish Presbyterian Church.
